intro: Pandiaka heudelotii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom from spring to autumn. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Pandiaka heudelotii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
